Posts.Content: Tr8cyg wrote: I was just diagnosed on the 10th. My appointment to find out treatment plan and surgery isn't until the 18th. The waiting is killing me. I'm totally in the dark and everything is just sinking in. Is it normal to be very nauseous? Or is it just nerves? When is the best time to tell the kids? I'm so worried about them. I can tell they know something is up. Their only 6 & 11. I'm scared and feel so alone even though I have friends and family by my side. Any suggestions on how to cope during this waiting game? Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: 43, Mother of 2 Young Boys and Scared! Tr8cyg DC197

Posts.Content: Jun 13, 2013 11:28AM Tr8cyg wrote: Lee, Thank you and please email. Today was the last day of school and I was lucky enough to catch the school social worker. She is emailing me links for my area. I love your approach with having the children play a role. That's exactly what my 11 yr old would insist upon. He's already asking to do things for me because he knows something is up. So sweet.
Posts.Title: 43, Mother of 2 Young Boys and Scared! Tr8cyg DC197

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2013 07:34AM Tr8cyg wrote: You all are such a blessing.  I'm back at work today and that's really helping, but Tuesday is approaching at a snails pace!!!!  Love you guys all ready and you are all in my prayers!
